result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certificate of Judge Requesting Attendance of Out of State Witness
Final pre-trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:06 PM Defendant Christopher L Larson in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Christopher L Larson.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  RL-clerk. FPT in 20CF497 and 20CF198, STC in files 21CF559, 21CF632, 22CF14, 21TR1438, 21TR1439, 21TR1653.

ADA Wood Webster indicates that 20CF497 only is resolved. Other cases must be scheduled out for trial. Felony warnings given re no firearms, loss of voting rights, etc. 
On count 1 in 20CF497- def- G plea. On count 2 in 20CF497- def- G plea. CT accepts pleas, adj G on count 1 and count 2. Def requests to waive PSI. Arguments. Def makes statement. JP-clerk.  

SENTENCE:
20CF497 count 1 & 2: W/H sentence, 3 years probation on each count.  Absolute sobriety.  No Contact with H.A.L. and graduate from Salvation Army.  $250 DNA surcharge on each count, DNA sample, along with fines/costs of $290.60 on each.  Must report to probation no later than 3:30 p.m. on Friday May 27th.  139 days credit.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  Bond to be applied to Attorney fee's first and any remaining bond to be applied to fines/costs.  JA to schedule JT and FPT, oldest file to be scheduled first, TR to track.  Bond continues on all other files.  4:31 adj.

CASES: 20CF198, 20CF497, 21CF559, 21CF632, 22CF14, 21TR1438, 21TR1439, 21TR1653.  9:02 AM Defendant Christopher L Larson appeared by video WLC from Salvation Army treatment program.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe appeared by video WLC for Christopher L Larson.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Not resolved. CT reviews status of cases- 20CF497 is still on calendar for JT on 6/2, and 20CF98 was continued for trial due to unavailability of witness. All other remaining files will be set for STC on 5/23/22 with FPT. Atty Dobbe- requesting video appearance for def for FPT. CT denies video appearance request, def must appear in person for FPT. Bond cont. 9:08 am adj.

CASES 21CF559, 21CF632, 22CF14. 8:46 AM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Christopher L Larson appeared by video.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe appeared by video for Christopher L Larson. Reading waived on all cases. Plea NG on all cases/charges. Bond cont. 8:48 am adj.
on Request to Appear Remotely for defense- Arraignment 5/2/22 and STC 5/2/22

Arraignment on May 2, 2022 at 08:45 am.

9:03 am. JL-Clerk. Defendant Christopher L Larson in court with attorney Matthew Dobbe.  Defendant Christopher L Larson in custody.  Holly D. Wood Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Dobbe motions for bond modification. State has no objection. CT sets new bond in 21CF632. CT now also calls cases 22CF14 and 21CF559.
CASES 21CF632, 22CF14, 21CF559 - PH: Def wishes to waive PH in all three cases. CT accepts waivers. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial in each case. Bonds cont. 9:22 am adj.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Arraignment scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
COVERS CASES: 21CF559 & 22CF14. Not to have contact with: H.A.L
